intro: Periloba pterosperma, commonly known as the African moonseed, is a flowering plant native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Menispermaceae and is characterized by its climbing habit and palmate leaves. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers that are followed by bright orange or red berries. Its roots and stems are used in traditional medicine for their purported health benefits. The botanical features of Periloba pterosperma make it an important species in both ecological and medicinal contexts.
